Art. 4.224. 
Inventory after death 
After the death of a person who has made a disposition subject to conservation, an inventory of all the property making up his estate is made in the ordinary manner, except however in the case of a specific legacy. This inventory contains a fair valuation of the furniture and personal property.
It is made at the request of the encumbered person and within the time limit set in Title 1, in the presence of the tutor appointed for the execution. The costs are taken from the property included in the disposition.
If the inventory has not been made at the request of the encumbered person within the above time limit, it is made within the following month, at the instance of the tutor appointed for the execution, in the presence of the encumbered person or his tutor.
If paragraphs 2 and 3 have not been complied with, the inventory is carried out at the request of the persons designated in article 4.223, paragraph 3, calling the encumbrancer or his tutor and the tutor appointed for enforcement.
